results.title: The Birth of a theory
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Addresses some controversial geological theories including the theories of Continental Drift and Plate Tectonics. It was only in the middle of the 20th Century that scientists accepted that the major continents were once joined and then drifted apart due to the geological activity occuring on and beneath the Earth’s surface. The study of the ocean floor provided valuable evidence which enabled the theory to eventually gain popular support.

results.title: Earth's interior
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Seismic waves, earthquakes and close study of rocks can give insight into the structure of the Earth. This episode looks at the field of geophysics in order to determine what the three composite parts which make up the Earth’s structure, i.e. the crust, mantle and core, are like. Measuring the magnetism in the Earth and its magnetic fields, looking at heat flow and measuring the Earth’s gravity are discussed. Geophysical research links the study of gravity, magnetism and seismology in order to fully comprehend the complexity of our planet.

results.title: The Restless planet
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Earth revealed”.
The creation of the planets in our solar system has had an enormous impact on the geological structure of the Earth,and the existence of life on the planet. This episode examines the origins of the solar system and planets, and how the Earth and its atmosphere evolved. The Earth and its inter-relationship with the planets is also examined.

results.title: Down to earth
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Earth revealed”.
This episode introduces the vast field of geology and the work undertaken by scientists in that and other related fields. Excellent visuals stimulate the viewer’s appreciation of the Earth and a broad overview is provided on Plate Tectonics, earthquakes, seismology and the origins of our planet.

results.title: Breathing for others
results.creator_credit: Guy Fergusson and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Emergency Resuscitation”.
Demonstrates the exhaled air method to save life in cases of asphyxia, drowning, gassing, electric shock and suffocation.

results.title: Training mannikin
results.creator_credit: Guy Fergusson and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Emergency Resuscitation”
Intended mainly for first aid instructors but also of interest to first aid classes, the various ways in which a manikin may be used to train a class to perform both exhaled air resuscitation and closed chest cardiac massage are demonstrated by an instructor and his pupils. Care and maintenance of the manikin is illustrated as well as the hygienic precautions taken to safeguard users.

results.title: Seconds count
results.creator_credit: Guy Fergusson and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Emergency Resuscitation”

A realistic and dramatic series of incidents likely to be met in service and civilian life, where exhaled air resuscitation may be the quickest or only way of saving life. Emphasises how important it is for the victims, once breathing has restarted, to be taken to hospital for further observations.

results.title: Closed chest and cardiac massage
results.creator_credit: Guy Fergusson and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Emergency Resuscitation”.
The techniques of closed chest cardiac massage is demonstrated by instructor, and by means of animated diagrams. The need for correct technique is stressed, when the method is used, accompanied by exhaled air resuscitation in cases of cardiac arrest and respiratory failure. The hazards of careless of misdirected application are explained.

results.title: Elizabeth R.
results.brief_description: Glenda Jackson received world-wide acclaim for her brilliant portrayal of Queen Elizabeth the Ist. The series begins just prior to Elizabeth’s ascension to the throne and continues to her death in 1603. The episodes deal with historical events such as the Armada, Mary Queen of Scots, the beheading of Essex, the plight over the Succession and her decision to remain unmarried. The series is well scripted, costumed and has an excellent cast.
results.description: Glenda Jackson received world-wide acclaim for her brilliant portrayal of Queen Elizabeth the Ist. The series is well scripted, costumed and has an excellent cast.
